document.title: Friday Writes: An Exercise in the Believing Game
document.abstract: I introduce the basic principles for the practice of proprioceptive writing and describe the experience and outcomes of incorporating this ungraded writing into three undergraduate compostion classes. I offer this as a case study of a writer, teacher, and reflective practitioner emboldened by Peter Elbow's believing game, and I point out some of the intellectual and pedagogical discoveries that emerged in my fourteen-week experiment.
document.publication-title: The Journal of the Assembly for Expanded Perspectives on Learning

field.name: acknowledgements
field.value: Stephanie Paterson is Associate Professor of English at California State University, Stanislaus. She teaches composition, creative nonfiction, and graduate seminars in Rhetoric and the Teaching of Writing (RTW). She also co-directs the Great Valley Writing Project and leads teacher research inquiry groups. Her website: http://www.csustan.edu/English/Paterson/.
